== Main Inclusion Report for sourcepackage ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/partman-prep, powerpc only
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for installation on IBM Power5 systems.
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=partman-prep|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=partman-prep|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** Runs as root within the installer.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'medium'.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:partman-prep|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/partman-prep.html|maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://www.debian.org/devel/debian-installer|upstream]]</nowiki> (i.e. Debian).
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Normal design for a partman component.
** Standard debhelper packaging.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.

=== Reviewers ===

I have reviewed this package, including doing some code review, and it seems sane.  '''Approved.''' --IanJackson 7.2.2007
